p: However, some studies have shown that in the two-dose vaccination program, when the first dose is administered before the age of 15 months, the susceptibility to measles infection is higher at up to 2â€“4 fold [ 82]. In this regard, it should be added that there is evidence of how, if the first dose is given before or after the age of 9 months, there is a lower antibody titer but the vaccination efficacy is not inferior, as the T-cell response is independent of vaccination timing. In any case, the WHO recommends two doses of vaccine when the first is administered before 9 months of age [ 83].
